author: joseph macdonald
comment: Been using this app for more than 3 years and it's never failed to work ! It's a app I do use, week in week out ..

author: Corvin Adkins
comment: Great app! It performs well and no battery drain. Excellent graphics. A+

author: Marlon Monzon
comment: Nice new icon!

author: Olav Norrud
comment: Bad navigation and lack of rise/set times. Can't step reliably 24h back and forth i single day view. No rise/set times from month view even with a tablet, removed? Otherwise ok I guess, with a nice widget, useless for me compared to a simple a table.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: An easy way to step exactly 24 hours forward or back is to open the Data ⓘ view - it has arrow buttons specifically for this purpose. UPDATE: Turns out that rise/set times being hidden when Calendar is open was a bug - it'll be fixed in the next release. Thanks for bringing it to my attention!

author: GariRae Gray
comment: After using the app for 6 years, it's  still great for photographers.  A one stop place for both moon and sun phase tracking, especially for long-term trip planning.

author: Helga S.
comment: An absolutely beautiful app that I've owned for many years and still love.

author: Terry King
comment: Been using since 2014 and like using as my wall paper. I love and have waiting for the current update with the blue, black moon's and solar eclipse.

author: Harold Campbell
comment: Simple yet beautiful wallpaper. Does what it says.

author: Dave Green
comment: Had an issue but developer got in touch straight away so back to 5 stars!

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: I'm not seeing this problem here, obviously - and it's tough to fix a problem I can't see. If you could email directly (there's a link in the app's About screen) to help track the problem down, that'd be my best chance at fixing it. Thanks!

author: Marilyn C.
comment: Super update! Thanks, dev!! 👍 I am really loving the update. ~ Very informative!

author: A Google User
comment: Best app in market

author: Vickie Carey
comment: Works great on my Galaxy Nexus and now on my S5. Love that I can set alarms for the next phase. ...BUT... It would be nice to define a time range for a silent alarm. I really didn't need to know the moon would be full at 3:45am. Setting a quiet time between hours I set (such as 11pm to 8am) would really be great!

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: The notification sound can be turned off in the app's settings. Or, on Android 5 (Lollipop), you can set your phone to filter out low-priority notifications at night; this will address this issue for all apps, not just Moon Phase Pro.

author: George Vazquez
comment: If you're interested in the nightly Moon phases, want to plan a nights lunar photography session or would like a wonderful Android Wear watch face, this app is for you.   Developer is also very responsive and keeps the app up to date. Well worth the price.  Couldn't be happier with the app.
title: A True Must Have

author: Frantisek Nagy
comment: Two things to point out: 1. The shine of the moon is too low, does not correspond with the reality. Would be great if we could adjust it. (just look up the sky at night and compare) 2. I would love to be able to position the moon on my screen (lower / higher / left / right), I don't like round things centered in LWPs. Edit: is it necessary to access the location so often? I'm using Fine mode and it keeps flashing the gps access all the time...

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback! 1. It's already as bright as Android's OpenGLES 3D rendering system can make it without blowing out the contrast. 2. This is already on my to-do list (but so are MANY other things, unfortunately). 3. I haven't seen excessive GPS use from this app, but I'll take another look.

comment: Nice to be able to get an image of the current moon, POW just like that. Also the whole month at a glance is nice. It would be nice to have length of day. Yes I know I could calculate it but that would be so hard to rack my brain. Wah. Anyway I has it on tablet and phone.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion - we'll add it to our list of things to do but can't make any promises on timescale.

title: Reliable, always works

author: Ryan Sickle
comment: The app is unreal.  Looks amazing on the Google Pixel, I have it as my wallpaper and lock screen.  I love how the moon turns as you slide screens.  Beautiful.  Only thing I would want the option for is to be able to change which part of the moon to have on the first screen.  I'm in the southern hemisphere and being that the phase moves from left to right down here, my second screen to the right is often the more accurate depiction of the moon phase.  So in order to have the correct phase of the moon on my lock screen, I need to make sure I swipe to the second screen before I lock.  Otherwise, perfect app.  Thank you

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks! The app SHOULD show you the correct moon orientation wherever you are - but I haven't had a chance to test it in the southern hemisphere. :^\ Would you mind emailing (there's a link in the app's About screen) to help me try to improve this?

author: Matthew Hunt
comment: I've been using Moon Phase Pro for quite a while to get all my essential moon facts after checking out a number of similar apps and concluding that this one was so much better that it was worth paying for the Pro version.  The latest release broke the app for me, but after I actually got in touch with the developer, all is well again. Thanks for the great app and support.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: I haven't seen any support requests from you before this comment - and obviously the app is working fine for me here. I understand your annoyance, but I can't fix a problem I don't know about. Please drop me an email so that we can work this out, thanks!

author: Shawn Roth
comment: Love it.. Wallpaper is great... But is there anyway you could add the current weather to the wear watch face?   (I'm asking for those of us who will never get android wear 2.0)

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: When your watch gets Android Wear 2.0 you can do this with a complication on the face. Please email us for more details or instructions!

author: Lanny Ross
comment: Its actually really awesome, its fun just to play with the phase cycle by swiping even. Just surreal in a way, wish it was a background too. *Awesome! Didn't even notice, thanks a lot.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: What do you want it to be a background for? It already includes a live wallpaper and an Android Wear watch face.

author: Joseph
comment: I love the way the moon display realistically tilts on it's axis, leaning the same way it would in real life, bright, lit, portion *leaning* forwards or backwards towards the below-horizon Sun.
title: Amateur astronomers, this is GOOD!

author: London Wolfe
comment: Sorry I wasted my money on this. I wanted the widget and it doesn't work

author: A Google User
comment: I love this app! Really cool live background too. Any time I upgrade or need to replace my phone, which is more often than I'd like to admit, this is the first app that I make sure to install.
title: Fantastic! I've used this app for years!

author: Guy Fawkes 05
comment: Is there anyway to make the moon smaller on the home screen when I use it as a live wallpaper?  Will give 5 stars if so.  Apart from that everything else is spot on.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: That's not currently supported in the app. Apologies.

title: Very good but...

author: A Google User
comment: It's wonderful exactly what I been looking for, and no issues I've found. Not yet in my usage anyways. Definitely recommended. 100% go for this one if u r really into Moon everything.
title: Love it

author: Rebecca Joynes
comment: I've had this as a free app on my Kindle and love the info you get with it, brilliant app well worth the small amount I had to pay to get it on my phone, less than £1.00.
title: Moon Phase Pro

author: Ninja Cat Trav
comment: I've always been interested in the Moon; Far more then the sun, this app let's me watch it via the App and the Live Wallpaper! I would buy this app for more that what it is listed! Kudos Dev!
title: Absolutely love the app!

author: Legend of the Phoenixx
comment: A Garou tends to need to know the phases of Mother Moon at all times in order to survive
title: Good.... Helps me alot

author: Rodger Bird
comment: This is my favorite Moon Phase app. I bought the app on the Amazon App store. When I gave up on Amazon, I re-purchased it thru Google Play. This app is well worth the money...

author: Nils Meier
comment: Somehow I feel a zoom function is in order to be able to compare more of the high res details with what I'm seeing in telescope. Rather than showing raise/set time I'd like like to have info on when I can observe, maybe above 30deg in my area between x and y

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestions. Zoom is in my plans but it's difficult to implement; I'll also consider adding an option for "rise/set" elevation.

author: Henry Scott Fitzgerald
comment: I'm not huge into astronomy or even astrology for that matter, but it's clear to me that keeping in touch with the phases of our most influential satellite is important, also fun to think about. Moon Phase will even notify users about upcoming meteor showers, supermoons, as well as the full, quarter, half, and new moon cycles. A live wallpaper of current phase is offered, as well as a resizeable widget. I enjoy keeping one next to my [other] clock on my home screen. I am grateful to know moonrise times too!
title: Far out... well, give or take 238,900 miles.... exactly what it ought to be!!

author: Anthony Rice
comment: This had been my wallpaper for years. Always awesome.
title: Best app of it's kind

author: mark Barnes
comment: Wotth the money. And I dont like to spend money

author: Kirt McClain
comment: I figured out the recipe for events long ago. Compare certain mass events to the lunar cycle. Aurora, Sandy Hook, Charleston and Chattanooga. See anything familiar? Guess what tomorrow, 8-15-15 is?
title: Great program.

author: Jeffrey Polaske
comment: I absolutely love how easy this app is to use. I also love the high quality of the graphics and smoothness of the app running. Well worth the price.
title: Love It

author: Uncle Gregy
comment: Favorite feature is the live wallpaper!  Would love to see the option of replacing the Moon with other objects such as planets or maybe even the Death Star. ;-P

author: A Google User
comment: Are you going to update to the S6, we just got the new phone and the app will not go from the S4 to the S6.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Unfortunately not at the moment. There is a Samsung problem that we're powerless to address (believe me, we've tried). If the situation changes we'll look at it again. .

title: Galaxy S6

author: Michael Thompson
comment: Used to like it, now it is not compatible with my new Note 5.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Unfortunately, this is a Samsung problem that we're powerless to address. We're no happier about it than you are.

author: Kris Sanchez
comment: Aside from a pretty picture of the moon.  There are plenty of other free apps that offer a lot more.  Don't waste your money.
title: Wish I could get refund

author: Marcia Wallace
comment: I dont like that it doesn't have the option to display the moon phase when using it as a wallpaper.  😕
title: Pretty good

author: Dan Parks
comment: Any chance of adding custom notifications? For example, when moon is setting within an hour of when the Sun is rising; Or when the moon is setting two hours after sunset, etc

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion. We are planning to extend the notification system at some point and will consider this when we do so.

title: Notifications
